title: Necrosis 2
author: ayobami
description: Definition of Terms relating to cell death

questions.question: t(necrosis)
questions.answer: a passive process in which cells are destoyed

questions.question: t(coagulative necrosis)
questions.answer: a type of necrosis where the architecture of the necrotic tissue is preserved. Caused mainly by protein denaturation.

questions.question: t(liquefactive necrosis)
questions.answer: a type of necrosis where the tissue gets liquefied due to enzymatic digestion forming pus.

questions.question: t(fat necrosis)
questions.answer: specialized fat tissue destruction mainly caused by unregulated release of pancreatic lipases as in acute pancreatitis

questions.question: t(gangrenous necrosis)
questions.answer: a specialized type of coagulative necrosis that occurs in the extremeties

questions.question: t(dystrophic calcification)
questions.answer: This occurs when Calcium gets deposited into tissue. It is one of the outcomes of necrosis

questions.question: t(enzymatic digestion)
questions.answer: Degradation of tissue due to enzymes usually from leukocytes. It is another outcome of necrosis
